result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob James Kirkpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Paid in full.
Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob James Kirkpatrick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob James Kirkpatrick in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob James Kirkpatrick
Current: 2107 Ontario Road, Green Bay, WI 54311 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2015)
Prior: 3129 Finger Rd, Green Bay, WI 54311

Defendant Jacob James Kirkpatrick in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress getting license. Defendant shows State license. Court questions offer. State advises of discussions with Defendant, makes offer. Court questions whether Defendant can get fine and costs paid within 60 days. Discussion regarding jail time. Court questions how Defendant would like to proceed. Defendant wants to take offer, put off sentencing. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Call from Defendant requesting his time be moved from 10:30 to 3:45.  Judge Diltz approved request.  DA's office was called on 8/10/15 and informed of time change only.
from Brown County DA's office for certified copy of bond and criminal complaint.

Defendant Jacob James Kirkpatrick in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advises that he can get license next month after 29th, has to get interlock on truck, get SR22, pay reinstatement fee. State is willing to reschedule to mid-August.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jacob James Kirkpatrick in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Amended Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews Amended Complaint, max. penalties. Defendant is confused about bail jumping charge. Court explains. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. State advises that Defendant is not eligible to reinstate until July 29.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Jacob James Kirkpatrick in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant makes statement, is unsure what he wants to do about an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
